Package BrickDestroy.JavaFX_SceneController

Class EndGameController

java.lang.Object
BrickDestroy.JavaFX_SceneController.EndGameController
public class EndGameController extends Object
Controller for handling the end game part of the View. It provides the high score list to the view and get the name of the player, to save the new high score.

  • Method Details

    • initialiseController

      public void initialiseController(HighScoreManager highScoreManager, int playerNewScore)
      Intialises the controller with the corresponding high score manager and the plaer's new score
      Parameters:
      highScoreManager - manager for handling the high scores
      playerNewScore - player's new score

    • setupScorePane

      public void setupScorePane()
      Sets up the GridPane scorePane to display the names and scores of person with the record of high scores.

      A TextField will be displayed on the row where the position of the players new score will be, to allow the player to enter their name.

    • checkIndexOutOfBounds

      private boolean checkIndexOutOfBounds(Integer index)
      Checks whether the current index is out of bounds in the linked list of high scores and names.
      Parameters:
      index - current GridPane row index
      Returns:
      whether it is out of bounds or not

    • zeroIfNull

      private int zeroIfNull(Integer number)
      Returns 0 if the integer is null
      Parameters:
      number - Integer object in question
      Returns:
      0 if the Integer object is null, itself if it's not

    • updateScorePane

      private void updateScorePane(int indexOfNewRecord, javafx.scene.Node nodeToRemove)
      Based on whether the player has made a new high score or not, it updates the texts and scorePane.

      If the player has made a new high score, the Text node on the row with the position of the players new record will be replaced with a TextField to allow the player to input their name.

      Parameters:
      indexOfNewRecord -
      nodeToRemove -

    • updateNewNameInHighScoreList

      private void updateNewNameInHighScoreList(boolean addedNewRecord)
      Updates the name of the player into the high score list from the TextField newName where the player typed their message.
      Parameters:
      addedNewRecord - flag to indicate whether a new record is added or not

    • exit

      void exit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Saves the list of high scores and exits into the main menu.
      Parameters:
      event - mouse clicked
      Throws:
      IOException
